api.database package¶

Submodules¶

api.database.api module¶

api.database.api.get_guild(*, bot: Bot, guild: Guild) → Guild¶

Gets a GuildBot object from the database.

First it tries to find records by guild ID in tables guild and settings.

If there are no records, it creates them using the functions auto_add_guild and add_settings.

Parameters:

  • bot (Bot) – Bot instance

  • guild (discord.Guild) – Discord guild object

Returns:

GuildBot object

Return type:

discord_models.Guild

api.database.api.get_guild_by_id(*, bot: Bot, guild_id: int) → Guild¶

Gets Guild object by guild ID.

Parameters:

  • bot (Bot) – Bot instance

  • guild_id (int) – guild ID

Returns:

Guild object

Return type:

discord_models.Guild

Raises:

ValueError – If guild not found

api.database.api.get_guild_by_owner(*, bot: Bot, owner_id: int) → Guild¶

Gets a Guild object by owner ID.

Parameters:

  • bot (Bot) – Bot instance

  • owner_id (int) – Owner ID

Returns:

Guild object

Return type:

discord_models.Guild

Raises:

api.database.enums module¶

class api.database.enums.DBFormat(value, names=None, *, module=None, qualname=None, type=None, start=1, boundary=None)¶

Bases: Enum

Listing of database data formatting modes.

Allows you to specify the required mode when making queries to the database.

Mode options:

  • Raw - Returns the data as is

  • List - Returns a list of values

  • One - Returns a single value

Example:

data = db.read("SELECT * FROM table", mode=DBFormat.List)
List = 2¶
One = 3¶
Raw = 1¶

api.database.orm module¶

api.database.orm.add_guild(guild_id: int, owner_id: int) → None¶

Adds a server to the database manually by ID.

Parameters:

  • guild_id (int) – server ID in Discord

  • owner_id (int) – server owner ID

api.database.orm.add_settings(discord_id: int) → None¶

Adds an entry to the settings table by discord_id

Parameters:

discord_id (int) – user or server ID

api.database.orm.auto_add_guild(guild: Guild) → None¶

Automatically adds the server to the database.

Parameters:

guild (discord.Guild) – Discord server object

api.database.tools module¶

class api.database.tools.DatabaseConnection(database_name: str | None = None)¶

Bases: DatabaseWraper

A class for working with database connection.

Inherits from DatabaseWrapper and adds methods for reading and writing data to the database.

Example:

With DatabaseConnection('data.db') as db:
    db.write("INSERT INTO table VALUES (?)", (1,))
    print(db.read("SELECT * FROM table", mode=DBFormat.List))
read(query: str, *args: Any, mode: DBFormat) → list[Any] | Any¶

Executes a query to read data.

Parameters:

  • query (str) – SQL query text

  • args (list) – Query parameters

  • mode (DBFormat) – Data formatting mode

Returns:

Query result

Return type:

list, dict or value

write(query: str, *args: Any, log_errors: bool = True, raise_errors: bool = False) → bool¶

Executes a query to write data.

Parameters:

  • query (str) – SQL query text

  • args (list) – Query parameters

  • log_errors (bool) – Log errors, default True

  • raise_errors (bool) – Raise errors, default False

Returns:

Successful execution of the request

Return type:

bool

class api.database.tools.DatabaseWraper(database_name: str)¶

Bases: object

A wrapper for working with SQLite database.

Allows you to open and close a connection, execute database queries.

Uses context manager to automatically open and close a connection.

Example usage:

With DatabaseWraper('db.db') as db:
    db.execute('SELECT * FROM table').
close() → None¶

Closes the database connection

execute(query: str, params: Tuple[Any]) → List[Any]¶

Executes an SQL query against a database.

Parameters:

  • query (str) – Query text

  • params (tuple) – Query parameters

Returns:

Query result

Return type:

list

open() → None¶

Opens a connection to the database.

api.database.tools.GenerateDatabase()¶

Generates database by schema if it does not exist.

Creates a database file using the path from the config if it does not exist. Executes the database schema script to initialise tables.

Uses DatabaseWrapper to work with the database.
